main.name: Brian Rus
main.bio: I'm a San Francisco Bay Area based Principal Consulant that enjoys learning new technologies and building things with them. Whether it's a new language, framework, BI tool, or storage system for truck campers, I find enjoyment learning how something works and creating my interpretation of it.
main.bio2: When I'm not building things I spend my weekends sailing, hiking, biking, camping, or any other activity that gets me out.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science (B.S.), Management Information Systems
education.description: Active member in a number of organizations, including the Gary J. Sbona Honors Practicum, Thompson Global Internship Program (TGIP), Management Information Systems Association (MISA), and the Delta Upsilon International Fraternity (DU).

work.title: Principal Consultant
work.description: Working with clients and internal stakeholders to bring actionable insights with an enjoyable user experience. We've built a team around our newly established cloud based offerings and are bringing them to market.

work.title: Consultant
work.description: Business Intelligence consultant primarily focused in Tableau development and maintaining the Teradata EDW for clients.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
